content.description: same start as Miguel's hill traverse, work your way to the face on the left now using a variety of progressively smaller holds, eventually reaching a good pinch near the top and top out. This one has the fear factor of falling backwards down the ledge so be sure to have pads and a spotter.Â

Sit start in the small cavey area (to the right of the drop) with a jug and a side pull . Work your way up the face using a crescent like crimp, a pinch, and the higher part of the arretes. Jug on left arret is off. Do a cheeky finger juggle at the triangle like ledge right before the top and move to the right without using the top of the boulder. There is a good undercling around the right side that you can use to get to the right most face and top out with a heel mantle.
content.location: On the face of "Over The Log" boulder

content.description: Same start as Miguel's Hill Traverse. Instead of going off to the right for the traverse, go straight up and top out. Jug on left arret is still off. Use the crescent like crimp, pinch, and higher parts of the arret to the top out.
Decent sized boulder to the left of a large rock face. May be a dangerous fall as there is a drop to the left of the boulder.
